summary: This is an email chain from October 2019 regarding the civil forfeiture matter in US v. Epstein. It involves attorneys coordinating a call to discuss representation of the Epstein estate, with Martin Weinberg introducing estate attorneys Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein to the government.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Attorney, Partner at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Identified as an attorney who will be representing the interests of the Epstein estate in the civil forfeiture matter. He is copied on the email chain and his contact information is provided.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Identified alongside Marc Weinstein as an attorney who will be representing the interests of the Epstein estate in the civil forfeiture matter.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: The initial sender of the email chain. He introduces the estate attorneys (Tomback and Weinstein) and states he will have a continuing role in the matters.

connections.description: Weinberg is coordinating legal representation for the Epstein estate and has identified Weinstein as one of the attorneys who will handle the civil forfeiture matter.
Weinberg is coordinating legal representation for the Epstein estate and has identified Tomback as one of the attorneys who will handle the civil forfeiture matter.
Both are identified as attorneys who will be jointly representing the interests of the Epstein estate in the civil forfeiture matter.

events.title: Email coordination for estate attorney call
events.description: Attorneys exchange emails to schedule a call regarding the US v. Epstein civil forfeiture matter and representation of the Epstein estate.

events.title: Weinberg introduces estate attorneys
events.description: Martin Weinberg sends an email introducing Andrew Tomback and Marc Weinstein as the attorneys who will represent the Epstein estate in future civil forfeiture matters.

locations: New York, NY 10004 (Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP office at One Battery Park Plaza)
Boston, MA 02116 (Law Office of Martin G. Weinberg, P.C. at 20 Park Plaza)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning the civil forfeiture case US v. Epstein.
Martin G. Weinberg identifies Andrew Tomback and Marc A. Weinstein as the attorneys who will represent the Epstein estate's interests in the forfeiture matter.
The emails show coordination in October 2019 to schedule a call between the estate's attorneys and government representatives.
The government side (recipients/other participants in the chain) is redacted or not fully named in the provided text.
The correspondence confirms the Epstein estate was actively engaging legal counsel for asset forfeiture proceedings following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
